title: Benfica Secures Dramatic Champions League Playoff Spot After Goalkeeper Late Header Against Real Madrid
body_text:
A Warm and Memorable Croissant Workshop at M Cook Studio
Section: Arts
Thu 29th Jan, 2026
In a remarkable conclusion to the Champions League group stage, Benfica claimed an unexpected spot in the playoffs after a dramatic 4-2 victory over Real Madrid, highlighted by an extraordinary last-minute goal from their goalkeeper, Anatoliy Trubin.
The match, played in Lisbon, was marked by high tension and relentless offensive pressure from Benfica. The Portuguese side dominated throughout, generating numerous scoring opportunities and testing Real Madrid's defense. Despite this, goals from Andreas Schjelderup and Vangelis Pavlidis had only put Benfica ahead 3-2 as the match entered stoppage time--an advantage that would not have been sufficient for progression to the next round.
With the clock deep into added time, Benfica's hopes seemed slim. However, following a foul by Real Madrid's Jude Bellingham, Benfica was awarded a free kick. In a rare move, goalkeeper Anatoliy Trubin pushed forward into the opposition's penalty area. As the cross was delivered into the box, Trubin leapt above the defenders and headed the ball into the net, securing a decisive fourth goal and prompting jubilation among Benfica players and supporters.
This result dramatically altered the Champions League's playoff picture. Benfica's additional goal propelled them into qualification, while Real Madrid, previously positioned in the top eight, dropped out of the leading spots and now faces extra matches in the competition. The defeat also sparked internal criticism within the Spanish club, as Real Madrid's defensive vulnerabilities were once again exposed. The team conceded a significant number of shots, and only the efforts of their goalkeeper Thibaut Courtois had prevented an even greater deficit.
After the match, analysis pointed to Real Madrid's lack of consistency and motivation as contributing factors to their defeat. The team's performance was described as lacking the necessary intensity and cohesion expected of a title contender. The loss has raised questions about the leadership and direction within the club, especially following recent managerial changes and fluctuating results in domestic and European competitions.
For Benfica, the victory marked a significant turnaround in a challenging season. Despite domestic setbacks and a disappointing cup run, the team managed to overcome adversity on the European stage. The outcome was also notable for manager José Mourinho, who achieved his first victory over his former club Real Madrid as a coach. Mourinho's tactical decisions during the closing stages were initially aimed at preserving the lead, but a recalculation by the coaching staff revealed that an additional goal was required for qualification. The resulting urgency led to Trubin's memorable goal and secured Benfica's advancement.
Trubin's achievement also placed him among a select group of goalkeepers who have scored in the Champions League, adding further significance to his contribution. His journey to Lisbon, having left Ukraine in 2023, and his pivotal role in this match have made his story particularly noteworthy within the football community.
Looking ahead, Benfica faces a challenging path in the playoff round, with the possibility of encountering either Real Madrid once again or Inter Milan, both considered leading contenders for the title. Mourinho, reflecting on the draw, emphasized the strength of the competition and managed expectations by positioning Benfica as underdogs despite their recent heroics.
The dramatic events in Lisbon have added a new chapter to Champions League history, underscoring the unpredictable nature of the tournament and the impact that individual moments can have on a team's fortunes.
